CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 19, 1944, pg. 13, reads: "Eckstine Steps Out - Billy Eckstine, the romantic singer of songs, gives out in a characteristic manner as he sings his latest hit, 'Good Jelly Blues.'  Tight: A shot of the great new orchestra Billy organized. The girl is Sara Vaughn [Sarah Vaughan], torrid vocalist with the Eckstine ork.  Billy and his boys go into the Regal theatre in Chicago on August 18, and everywhere the band shows Billy wins rave notices.  He's got it. - Harris Photo."Aragon Ballroom was at 628 Penn Avenue.
TitMainTitle: Copy of a photograph of Billy Eckstine's band performing at on stage, seen from above, including Sarah Vaughan and Billy Eckstine, Lucky Thompson, Charlie Parker, Bob "Junior" Williams, Leo Parker, Charlie Rouse, Dizzy Gillespie, Marion "Boonie" Hazel, Howard McGhee, Howard Scott, Jerry Valentine, Taswell Baird, Linton Garner, Art Blakey, and Connie Wainwright, Aragon Ballroom
